TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class AbstractInterruptibleChannel : Java.Lang.Object, IDisposable, Java.Nio.Channels.IInterruptibleChannel

.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit AbstractInterruptibleChannel extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class Java.Nio.Channels.IChannel, class Java.Nio.Channels.IInterruptibleChannel, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: AbstractInterruptibleChannel is the root class for interruptible channels.

remarks.para: AbstractInterruptibleChannel is the root class for interruptible channels.

The basic usage pattern for an interruptible channel is to invoke begin() before any I/O operation that potentially blocks indefinitely, then end(boolean) after completing the operation. The argument to the end method should indicate if the I/O operation has actually completed so that any change may be visible to the invoker.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void Begin() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates the beginning of a code section that includes an I/O operation that is potentially blocking.

remarks.para: Indicates the beginning of a code section that includes an I/O operation that is potentially blocking. After this operation, the application should invoke the corresponding end(boolean) method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

remarks.para: Closes an open channel. If the channel is already closed then this method has no effect, otherwise it closes the receiver via the implCloseChannel method.
If an attempt is made to perform an operation on a closed channel then a is thrown.
If multiple threads attempt to simultaneously close a channel, then only one thread will run the closure code and the others will be blocked until the first one completes.

Docs.exception: if a problem occurs while closing this channel.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void End(bool success) cil managed

Docs.param: pass true if the blocking operation has succeeded and has had a noticeable effect; false otherwise.
Docs.summary: Indicates the end of a code section that has been started with begin() and that includes a potentially blocking I/O operation.

remarks.para: Indicates the end of a code section that has been started with begin() and that includes a potentially blocking I/O operation.

Docs.exception: if this channel is closed by another thread while this method is executing.
if another thread interrupts the calling thread while this method is executing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void ImplCloseChannel() cil managed

remarks.para: Closes the channel with a guarantee that the channel is not currently closed through another invocation of close() and that the method is thread-safe.
Any outstanding threads blocked on I/O operations on this channel must be released with either a normal return code, or by throwing an AsynchronousCloseException.

Docs.exception: if a problem occurs while closing the channel.

Docs.summary: Returns true if this channel is open.

remarks.para: Returns true if this channel is open.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
